alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 20 at 11:10AM PST until January 23 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Minor beach erosion and minor tidal overflow. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast and Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast. * WHEN...Through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Pooling of sea water is possible around high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. Minor beach erosion is also possible. No significant damage is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The time of greatest concern will be during morning high tide which will range between 7.0 and 7.2 feet between 800 AM and 930 AM this weekend.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast
